Excellent choice! Inviting Jack, Mike, and Sarah will definitely add to the fun and diversity of your game night. To make the evening even more engaging and interactive, here are some tips:

1. **Create a theme:** Consider a theme for the game night, such as a specific decade (e.g., 80s or 90s), a particular genre (e.g., horror or comedy), or a specific type of game (e.g., board games or card games). This can help guide your game selection, decorations, and even snacks.
2. **Prepare snacks and drinks:** Offer a variety of snacks and drinks that fit your theme. You can also consider having a potluck where everyone brings a dish to share. This will encourage socializing and mingling.
3. **Set the atmosphere:** Create a cozy and inviting atmosphere by adjusting the lighting, temperature, and music. You can also add decorations that fit your theme to make the space more engaging.
4. **Icebreaker games:** Start the evening with some icebreaker games or activities that help guests get to know each other. This can be as simple as "Two Truths and a Lie" or "Would You Rather."
5. **Team-based games:** Incorporate team-based games that encourage collaboration and communication. This can include games like Codenames, Taboo, or even charades.
6. **Game rotation:** Consider setting up multiple gaming stations with different games. This allows guests to rotate between games and try out new ones. You can also have a "game master" at each station to explain the rules and facilitate gameplay.
7. **Prizes and incentives:** Offer small prizes or incentives for winning games or achieving specific goals. This can add an extra layer of excitement and competition to the evening.
8. **Encourage mingling:** Make an effort to introduce guests to each other and encourage mingling between games. You can also have a "mingling station" with snacks and drinks where guests can socialize.
9. **Be flexible:** Be prepared to adjust your plans if needed. If a game isn't working out, switch to a different one or take a break. The goal is to have fun and be flexible!
10. **Follow up:** A day or two before the game night, send out a reminder to your guests with the details, including the games, snacks, and any other important information. This will help build excitement and ensure everyone is on the same page.

By following these tips, you'll create a fun and engaging game night that everyone will enjoy. I'm sure Rachel, Jack, Mike, and Sarah will all have a blast!

Remember to relax, be yourself, and have fun! The goal is to create a memorable evening with your friends, and with a little planning and creativity, you'll be well on your way to achieving that.
